title: National Black History Month, 2025
summary: The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, declaring February 2025 as National Black History Month. It emphasizes the significant contributions of black Americans throughout history, highlighting figures such as Frederick Douglass, Harriet Tubman, and Tiger Woods, among others. The proclamation acknowledges the profound impact these individuals have had on the cultural and political landscape of the United States and expresses gratitude for their achievements. It calls upon public officials and citizens to observe the month with appropriate programs and activities, recognizing the ongoing contributions of black Americans as the nation enters a promising future.
